name: Sonesta Great Bay Beach Resort & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff at Sonesta Great Bay Resort was excellent. They absolutelty made my trip. There was just never a dull moment. The resort was beautiful, the room was beautiful, the pools, the beach, the drinks, the food...all of it was superb.
reviews.title: A good time was had by all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Special shout out to the animation staff for keeping the good times going - Kevin, Denroy
reviews.title: RUN FOR THE HILLS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Special shout out to the bartenders - Nigel and Alex for bringing out the sunshine
reviews.title: The Staff made this place unbearable, couldn't wait to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Special shout out to Camille and Ruffino - for going the extra step to make meals feel special
reviews.title: Your vacation is what you make it, not what the hotel makes it - awesome time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If i could give zero stars, I would! The minute we arrived there were 2 leaks in the ceilings in the lobby....I already felt this could be a sign. Reception staff were lax, unhelpful, borderline rude. We arrived at 1 pm and were told to come back at 2:30 pm. We went back at 2 pm, and were told " i said 2:30 pm". I mean, who does that??? What ever happened to common courtesy.The room was ready at 3:15 pm, furthermore, the resort wasn't even full!
reviews.title: honeymooners had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I usually pick one all-inclusive trip a year. This year my friend and I picked Sonesta Great Bay. Upon arrival at the hotel there was one receptionist that either didn't know what she was doing or was just very slow. We could see from our folder that we were originally set up to be in a room on the 4th floor. She put us on the 1st floor. Since we were in a mountain view, this put us below grade. It was like staying in a basement. One morning upon opening the curtains, a worker was right outside our sliding door watering the plants, not to mention the only road surrounding the island was 50 feet away. There was only 2 bottles of water in our refrigerator (supposed to be stocked with sodas, beers, and liquor). When we continuously complained, we were moved 3 days into our trip to an oceanview room, which was much better. However, the air conditioner leaked large puddles all over the tile floor.
reviews.title: Can't Believe Anyone would rate high

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff continuously complained about the new management that the said took over a couple of months ago. There was a very limited amount of selection of alcoholic drinks. We requested guavaberry liquor, which is the island's known drink, and were told management took that away. The service at the buffet was hit or miss. Patricia was a good waitress so look for her. As far as the food, the buffet was mainly the same foods over and over. There was only one other restaurant on the site, Molasses, and it was only open a couple nights a week. The food and service was fairly good there.
reviews.title: Sonesta not so Great Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: You have to use a paper card to get a pool towel and if you loose the paper card you pay $10, not to mention that half the time you go for a towel no personnel or towels would be there.
reviews.title: Not what we were expecting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach is nice, but don't let the color of the water fool you. It is very murky (not sure if it's the abundance of salt). If you do go in the water definitely take advantage of the raft rental. You pay a $5 deposit for a very nice raft. They give you your $5 when you bring it back.
reviews.title: Very dissapointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our favorite part of the vacation was a sailing trip on the Random Wind. It was only $99 per person if you book yourself and is well worth the excursion. We also enjoyed a taxi trip to Orient Beach. The sand there is powdery soft and the water is crystal clear and warm. There is a portion of the beach that is nude, but it's down the end, separated, and you may walk down there without removing your clothes.
reviews.title: great vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from 8/11-8/18 and really had no problems. We were in one of the timeshare units (Studio room 263) and it met our needs. We did not do the all-inclusive package as we don't like feeling limited to just the resort. Rather we prefer to go out and about and explore on our own. We did not have as much interaction with staff as others who have commented, but we did not have any issues with the staff that we did have contact with. Granted, they were not overly friendly or helpful, but I can not say that anyone was rude either. We ate at the beach cafe a couple times and had the breakfast buffet one time. The food was good, but the buffet was pricey. Over $40 for 2 people. A bit much for breakfast I think.
reviews.title: Met our needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was adequate. It was clean and there was NO mildew smell that so many others mention. Always had good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The view from our room was gorgeous! We weren't crazy about the beach here. The sand is large grains of crushed shells and it does get deep quickly. The water was a beautiful turquoise, but it always seemed cloudy. We only spent a couple days here.
reviews.title: Awesome 50th Birthday celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented a car for a day from the Hertz at the hotel and had no problems. Driving on the island took some getting used to, but wasn't too bad. We went to Orient Beach which was very nice. Also a must do is to go to Maho Beach to watch the planes. Lots of fun and a beautiful beach, although small. We also did a day trip to Anguilla by taking the ferry from Marigot. I highly recommend making the trip. Shoal Bay is the most beautiful beach!! Just make sure to take your passport. You will need it to get into Anguilla.
reviews.title: Very disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Do not take taxis, but use the buses instead. They only charge $2 a person (one way). You have to walk to Back Street in Philipsburg to catch a bus, but it's really easy. They display the location they are going to in the window. Wave to them to stop and get on. Be sure to ask the driver to alert you when you get to the stop that you need. We found all of the drivers to be very nice and helpful in getting us to our destination.
reviews.title: Awesome island, subpar staff (except Animators and select bartenders), average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is definitely not a 5 star resort, but it's also not a total dump. If you're just looking for a place to crash after a long day of exploring, then give this place a try. If you're planning to just stay at the resort all week, you may want to look for something else. And if you're the kind of person who expects to be treated like royalty and complains about every little thing, do everyone a favor and just stay home.
reviews.title: Hotel was awful but Animators and the Island were amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I spent a week here in August 2012. Let me just say at the outset that we are budget travelers and do not expect the Ritz when we are paying budget prices.
reviews.title: Not many complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BEACH: The hotel is on a long strip of beach with gorgeous teal blue water. The water is not crystal clear (probably because the waves are so strong) but it is still very beautiful. The beach leading to the water is very steep and the sand is somewhat coarse, but these were not significant issues since the beach is so gorgeous otherwise. You can rent a float from the hotel to take into the ocean and lay on- my fiance found that very relaxing. There was a very faint smell of sewage every once in awhile as we were laying on the beach, which we overheard other couples notice as well. It wasn't strong enough to really bother us though and it wasn't there all the time. The "island ladies" were a little annoying to me because they were so loud talking amongst themselves when I really just wanted to relax and not hear voices right in my ear. The hotel needs to get rid of them. We saw them asking people to go up to the buffet and bring them back free food! Don't expect the person who mans the beach towel stand to be there very often. It was frustrating when we went down there at 9 or 10 am and no one was there to hand out towels. Luckily, we had packed our own and used them. There were a couple island dogs roaming around the beach. They were sweet and harmless but it was extremely depressing to see what bad shape they were in. We gladly snuck them some food and water from the buffet. This island needs an SPCA or something to take these poor dogs in.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: FOOD: This place is a meat lover's dream. I am not a meat lover, but was always able to find something to eat. Unfortunately, there is no pasta ever at any meal, at least not while we were there. There is always chicken or ribs or lamb or roast beef for lunch and dinner at the buffet. They have great fresh salad foods and decent desserts. I am a VERY picky eater and I never went hungry, so that should say something. The quality of their meat was excellent, too. The best place to eat though, in my opinion, is the grill down by the pool during lunch. They have pizza, burgers, hot dogs and french fries. However, they did run out of french fries one day, which was a little irritating because that just should not happen at a hotel that advertises itself as all-inclusive. They actually ran out of other things as well, like beach towels and certain drinks, so I think that's why this annoyed me. My fiance and I began to theorize that they have allotted a certain amount of each item to be used each day, and once it's used they just tell you they are all out of that.
reviews.title: Sonesta Great Bay is barely two stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DRINKS: Totally watered down so your best bet is wine or beer. I don't think there was any alcohol at all in my daiquiris or margaritas. Never had banana daiquiri mix which was annoying.
reviews.title: great bay great food great people great location great vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS: Very modern and clean. AC worked great. A few tiny ants in the bathroom sink but nothing too bad. Only bad thing was that when I went to turn on the shower for the first time, the handle completely came off. I just put it back on loosely and made it work. It should really be fixed though. They only forgot to replace our bath towels one time and as soon as we requested more, they came right away with more. The room safe is in a very inconvenient spot- it's in the closet on the floor almost. It was a pain to keep bending down in that closet to get stuff in and out of it. I want to be lazy on vacation...
reviews.title: Carribean Vacation

aka: Sonesta Great Bay Beach Resort And Casino
description: Overlooking beautiful Great Bay Harbor and a short, 10-minute walk from the exciting capital of Philipsburg, Sonesta Great Bay Beach Resort & Casino offers the best of both worlds: great shopping, dining and entertainment in a quaint downtown setting, and a tropical escape within a beach front oasis. With spectacular views, unparalleled service, a full range of amenities and a mile of white, sandy beach, the Sonesta Beach Resort provides the ultimate Caribbean experience.
